data.title: Who is Savannah James? Here’s all you may want to know about LeBron James’ family
data.meta_description: During the quarantine, LeBron James' family has become an internet sensation, amassing a huge following on TikTok.
data.text:
Synopsis

During the quarantine, LeBron James' family has become an internet sensation, amassing a huge following on TikTok.

LeBron James, the legendary NBA player, is also a devoted father to his three children. He is married to his high school sweetheart, Savannah James, and they have two sons, LeBron “Bronny” Jr. and Bryce, and a daughter named Zhuri. The James family has gained massive popularity on TikTok during the quarantine, with their dance videos going viral and showcasing their close bond. When they're not dancing, the family supports each other and attends red-carpet premieres together.

Who is LeBron James’ wife Savannah James?

LeBron James and his wife, Savannah, have a heartwarming love story that began in their teenage years at St. Vincent-St. Mary High School in Akron, Ohio. They grew closer as they faced the challenges of young adulthood together. Their bond endured as LeBron rose to basketball stardom, culminating in a proposal on New Year's Eve 2012, where he presented Savannah with a stunning pear-shaped diamond ring.

They tied the knot on September 14, 2013, in a lavish wedding ceremony in San Diego, California, attended by celebrities and fellow athletes. Beyond being partners in love, they are also business partners, with Savannah playing a significant role in supporting LeBron's career and managing their joint business ventures. Their love story is a testament to their enduring relationship both on and off the basketball court.

Who are LeBron James’ children?

Born on October 6, 2004, “Bronny” Jr. James is the oldest of LeBron James' three children. He has displayed remarkable talent on the basketball court, following in his father's footsteps. At the young age of 16, he made history by gracing the cover of Sports Illustrated for his achievements in e-sports with FaZe Clan. LeBron has expressed his desire to share the court with his son in his final NBA season, creating an extraordinary father-son partnership.

Bryce James, the middle child, was born on June 14, 2007, and shares his father's passion for basketball. He has been showcasing remarkable talent on the court, particularly with his slam dunks that draw comparisons to his dad's younger days. LeBron's aspiration of playing alongside both his sons in the NBA is still a possibility, and Bryce's basketball future appears to hold great promise.

The youngest member of the James family was born on October 22, 2014. Zhuri James holds a special and cherished place in LeBron's heart, and he frequently shares heartwarming moments with her on social media. With her own Instagram and YouTube channel, Zhuri displays her many talents to her followers.

FAQs:

Q1:Who is LeBron James?

LeBron James is a renowned professional basketball player, widely recognized as one of the greatest in NBA history. His impressive accolades include four NBA championships, four NBA MVP awards, and four NBA Finals MVP awards. Additionally, he is a two-time Olympic gold medalist.

Q2:When did LeBron James and Savannah marry?

LeBron James and Savannah Brinson tied the knot on September 14, 2013, at the Capella Chapel Grand Del Mar hotel in San Diego, California. Their wedding was graced by approximately 200 guests, among them James' Miami Heat teammates Dwyane Wade and Chris Bosh, and renowned celebrities Beyoncé and Jay-Z.
